alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued June 27 at 2:15AM MDT until June 27 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR THE NORTHWEST PLATEAU, WEST CENTRAL MOUNTAINS, NORTHEAST AND CENTRAL HIGHLANDS DUE TO VERY LOW HUMIDITY, STRONG WINDS AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .Strengthening southwest flow across northwestern New Mexico will combine with an extremely dry and unstable atmosphere today to produce critical to locally extreme fire weather conditions. In addition, mostly dry showers and thunderstorms over the region will be capable of strong and erratic downburst winds. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Red Flag Warning...which is in effect from noon today to 8 PM MDT this evening. * AREA AND TIMING...Central Highlands (Zone 125) from noon today to 8 pm MDT this evening. Dry showers and thunderstorms with gusty variable winds are possible. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts to 40 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...10 to 15 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.
